ai.summary: The Green Link Walk (Section 1) is a 14.9 km moderate hike in the UK, weaving through a mix of green spaces and countryside edges. This first section offers a scenic route with steady trails, suitable for hikers with moderate experience and good fitness. Expect varied surfaces, gentle ascents, and rewarding views along the way.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed terrain with well-trodden paths, grassy tracks, and sections of compact soil. Some areas may be uneven or muddy after rain. Elevation gains are gradual with a few gentle climbs; watch for roots and wet patches.
ai.safety_notes: Carry a map and compass or GPS, stay on marked paths, and wear sturdy footwear. Check the weather forecast and be prepared for changing conditions. Bring enough water and snacks, a small first aid kit, and a layerable waterproof clothing. Hike with others when possible and tell someone your route and ETA. Be mindful of cyclists on shared paths and patchy mobile signal in rural areas.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) for the most favorable weather and daylight; summer offers longer days but can be hot, while early spring and autumn provide mild conditions and sceneries.

seo.title: Green Link Walk (Section 1) – 14.9 km Moderate Hike in the UK
